features: [High performance]:Thermal conductivity is 7.0w/m.k, This ensures that heat from the CPU/GPU is dissipated quickly & efficiently.

[Stability]:The available temperature is -55℃/ +200℃,Thermal Impedance@40Psi: 0.008C*in/W, density is 2.6g/cm³,viscosity@25C: 3000kcps . Even in high or low temperature environment, its cooling advantage will not be affected.
[Security]:Non-conductive and contains zero volatile compounds, non corrosive, harmless, It is friendly to CPU and GPU and will not damage electronic components.

[Durability]:Thermal conductive silicone grease has long service life and low volatility, which can maintain its thermal conductivity in CPU, GPU, radiator module, chipset, sensor and other electronic components for a long time.

[Easy to Use]:Convenient for application and storage. the paste is not stiff and comes with a spatula, the moderate viscosity can be easily applied for a Homogeneous thin layer, so that all beginners can easily apply it.
body.description: Thermal Paste (2g) 7W/mk -Ultimate Performance for Cooling All Processors, CPU, GPU, IC Processor, Carbon Based High Performance, Thermal Interface Material

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.3 4.3 out of 5 stars 8 ratings 4.3 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Passes Test for Thermal Efficiency
reviews.reviewText: This is low-priced thermal paste kit. The paste was relatively thick and sticky, but it applied and spread fine. I needed a simple test to see it its performance is adequate for ordinary use. I used a Cinebench R23 benchmark. The test system was an Intel I3-10100 4C/8T @ 3.6 GHz processor with a Cooler Master i71 CPU cooling fan. The control was a graphite thermal pad proven to be nearly as good as the paste I use currently. With this humble system, the benchmark score and wattage used where virtually the same as expected without thermal throttling. The maximum temperature and fan speed showed real improvement. Thermal Pad Amgchiron PasteMaximum Temperature 71 deg C. 67 deg C. 5.6 % improvementMaximum Fan RPM 1229 rpm 1157 rpm 5.8 % improvementThis is much better cooling than I expected, and this appears to be a good product for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Average Thermal Paste for the Seldom/Moderate Computer User
reviews.reviewText: Thermal paste is designed to minimize microscopic air spaces and irregularities between the surface of the cooler and the CPU's integrated heat spreader. Having a good thermal paste is key because it allows the processor to transfer more of its waste heat to your cooler, keeping your processor running cool.The AMG Chiron Model: TG-070 has the following:1. Thermal Conductivity: 7.0 W/mk = Average/Weak. [The more thermal conductivity you have, the better]2. Composition: Silicone Based = Creates a messy application process and poor stability. I would prefer an aluminum/silver/ceramic based formula, that of course increases the cost. However, you don't want it drying up and cracking!3. Density: 2.6 g.cm^-3 = My paste was clumpy, indicating the shelf life (which is listed as 6 months) is pretty weak.Overall, when investing into a computer you want to ensure the longevity of the processor. Sure, if someone only uses a computer to check emails, this paste may as well do the trick, but why risk it. Invest in a better quality thermal paste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is good quality thermal paste. It is easy to apply with the included applicator. I am running this on my ryzen 5 5600 and it does a great job at keeping temperatures in check. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Efficient Paste Comes With Applicator
reviews.reviewText: Thermal efficiency looks great, so far on an ancient 45nm cpu with stock HS/fan temps are very good. Applicator makes spreading thinly super easy. So much easier than the old polar silver stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy to apply - includes a nice screw on cap for storage in the syringe
reviews.reviewText: Picture shows me applying it to a Ryzen 7 cpu. I then attached a thermaltake AIO, but had to remove it for an installation issue unrelated to the thermal paste. Bottomline, when I removed the cooler, the thermal paste was evenly spread across the cpu. I haven't run any intense games but for normal every day computing, the cpu runs a consistent 40-45 degrees.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Standard quality, similar to others in the market
reviews.reviewText: This thermal paste was used during the CPU upgrade of my son's computer. It was easy to apply, but was not a miracle solution that worked wonders. We thought the quality was about average, more like "it did the minimum" for a thermal paste. However, it's cheap and not any worse than similar generic brands in the marketplace. For the average user, no need to get anything fancier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well for gaming PC build
reviews.reviewText: This thermal paste kit includes a spatula and a CPU cleaner wipe. I have used this to re-applied thermal for the RX 580 graphics card and the temp has dropped significantly down to the normal 60 - 65C range. I also used this for my new PC build with the Intel 12th gen and the temp has been stable at 35C at idle and up to max temp at around 60C. This thermal paste is non-conductive so it is ok to apply it moderately. This 2 gram tube should last 5 to 6 uses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and effective.
reviews.reviewText: In comparison, the thermal conductivity of this paste is in between that of Arctic MX-2 and MX-4. In performance, I notice no difference in temps on my 240mm AIO cooled 5600X compared to my normally used Noctua NT-H1. At under $4 (after coupon), it's a worthy thermal solution especially if you are one that needs to re-paste often.
